page.title: 08Ridgehill or Regil ?
page.content: If you are looking for Regil on an Ordnance Survey Map, I doubt whether you would find it. On most maps nowadays, Regil is written as Ridgehill. Local people write Regil. Anyway, the place is situated south of Winford and most people have never heard of it! There is a village hall, an updated telephone box which is hardly ever used and a noticeboard which is nearly always full. There is a postbox in the wall of the old school house and I've heard people say that the letters are eaten by snails before the postman arrives to collect them! There are about 200 people living in Regil today. There are 4 or 5 farms and some people have started their own small holdings. Quite a few of the inhabitants commute between Regil and Bristol or Regil and the local pub!
